page.title: 07TOURISM
page.content: Over the past five years there has been an increased awarness in the District Council about the need to stimulate {Tourism}with the appointment of a Tourist Manager in charge of Clydesdale ,Hamilton and Motherwell Districts. This move has resulted in more visitors to the area in particular to {New Lanark},which is known internationally as one of the most important places for the development of industrial relations. In Lanark itself tourists usually come to view the {Lanimers }or simply to do their shopping.Some potential to attract tourists to Lanark has been lost due to the lack of a museum.Finally on the subject of { {Tourism }mention must be made of the fine walks around Lanark Loch and the Race Course.
